business.headline: From income reporting to form selection: 7 must-do ITR stepsThis article outlines the key things taxpayers in India need to remember while filing their income tax return for the current assessment year, with a focus on accuracy, compliance, and timely processing.

Infosys shares up 2% on record buyback plan. Will existing shareholders benefit?Infosys shares climbed over 2% after the IT firm announced a Rs 18,000 crore buyback, the largest in its history. The offer, priced at a 19% premium, could benefit existing shareholders, though experts caution on execution challenges.
Dalal Street momentum: Top sectors to invest in todayExperts believe that from Q3 onwards, earnings should improve due to GST rationalisation and income tax cuts, which will start paying off.

Thinking of borrowing for your next foreign trip? Here's why you shouldn'tA surge in Indians borrowing for foreign trips raises financial concerns. CoinSwitch's founder offers insights into prudent financial practices to prevent potential debt accumulation.
Markets open higher on Fed rate cut optimism; Infosys leads gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 211.13 points to 81,759.86 at 9:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 66.665 points to trade at 25,072.15.

Explained: Why SIP investors on trading apps must check XIRR, not just returnsIn SIPs, investments enter the market at different times. Some stay for years, others only months. Absolute returns treat them alike, distorting the picture. XIRR offers a more accurate measure.

Urban Company IPO closes today. Is it a risky bet as GMP soars on last day?Urban Company's initial public offering ends its bidding phase today after strong investor interest and rising grey market premiums.

Gold touches new lifetime high of Rs 1.13 lakh per 10 grams in DelhiGold prices surged to a new lifetime high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams in Delhi on Thursday. The yellow metal has gained over 43% this year. Experts attribute the surge to central bank buying, exchange-traded funds inflows, and geopolitical tensions.

Zupee lays off 30% of staff as it adapts to India's Online Gaming ActZupee has rolled out a comprehensive relief package for employees affected by the layoffs. The support plan includes financial assistance beyond the standard notice period, with extra compensation based on years of service.
Will Diwali light up Dalal Street for investors?While the festival is often seen as a time for good fortune, experts say the stock market doesn't necessarily follow festive trends.
Rupee slides to all-time low as US tariffs biteThe Indian rupee hit a record low of 88.44 against the US dollar on Thursday, pressured by US tariffs and heavy foreign investor outflows.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains amid optimism over US-India trade dealThe NSE Nifty50 rose by 32.40 points to close at 25,005.5, while the BSE Sensex increased by 123.58 points, settling at 81,548.73.

entertainment.headline: Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas steal a kiss before Ralph Lauren showPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas shared an intimate moment ahead of the Ralph and Lauren show. The global icon shared pictures of the couple on social media, which are just dripping love.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle box office prediction: Biggest anime loading in India 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' has stormed the Indian box office with record-breaking advance bookings, eyeing a Rs 20 crore opening and historic anime milestones. Here's all about it.

Blackmail review: GV Prakash's thriller is lesson 101 in convenient writingRelease Date:Thu Sep 11, 2025Blackmail movie review: Director Mu Maran's 'Blackmail', starring GV Prakash, Srikanth, and Bindu Madhavi, is a thriller about a bunch of characters who blackmail each other to get out of trouble. However, the film is a lesson in how convenient screenplay writing can be.

KJo jokes about The Summer I Turned Pretty, says Student of the Year did it firstKaran Johar recently drew comparisons between 'The Summer I Turned Pretty' and 'Student of the Year'. He shared a post on Instagram and stated how his directorial did it first.

Kartik Aaryan meets specially-abled fan from Varanasi, calls it his good karmaActor Kartik Aaryan recently got emotional after he met a specially-abled fan from Varanasi. Kartik even shared a special post for the fan on social media.

S/o Muthanna review: Emotionally charged but technically weak father-son storyRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025S/o Muthanna movie review: Written and directed by Sriikanth Hunsur, this Kannada film featuring Pranam Devraj, Rangayana Raghu and Kushee Ravi in the lead, is banking on its emotional core. But, is that enough?

Actor Karishma Sharma jumps from moving local train, sustains injuriesActor Karishma Sharma sustained serious injuries after jumping from a moving local train in Mumbai. She updated fans about her condition via a post on social media.

Mirai review: Teja Sajja's fantasy epic delivers big thrills on small budgetRelease Date:Fri Sep 12, 2025Mirai movie review: 'Mirai' narrates the story of a young warrior tasked with the protection of nine sacred scriptures that can turn any mortal into a deity. It delves into human values and emotions like compassion, ethics, hatred and greed.

Never done anything wrong: Raj Kundra on Rs 60-crore against him, Shilpa ShettyBusinessman-producer Raj Kundra commented on recent cheating allegations involving him and Shilpa Shetty. In an interview with India Today, Kundra maintained that neither he nor Shetty had done anything wrong.

Siddharth joins Freida Pinto for Netflix family drama Unaccustomed EarthActor Siddharth will lead Netflix's 'Unaccustomed Earth' alongside Freida Pinto. The family-drama series explores complex relationships within an Indian American community of Cambridge.

Ed Sheeran says watching Om Shanti Om is like introducing someone to Star WarsEd Sheeran expressed his admiration for actor Shah Rukh Khan's 'Om Shanti Om' and India's cultural diversity. His reflections highlight the rich talents and unique cinematic experiences across India.

Vampire Diaries' Nina Dobrev and Shaun White split 5 years after engagement: ReportAmerican snowboarder Shaun White and 'The Vampire Diaries' actor Nina Dobrev have ended their engagement, according to reports. The duo dated for five years before getting engaged in 2024

After Coolie cameo, Aamir Khan's next with Lokesh Kanagaraj shelved: ReportThe much-anticipated Aamir Khan–Lokesh Kanagaraj superhero project is reportedly shelved, leaving fans wondering about the director's next moves.

Tamannaah Bhatia, Diana Penty glam up Do You Wanna Partner screeningActors Tamannaah Bhatia and Diana Penty made a stylish appearance at the screening of 'Do You Wanna Partner.' The supporting cast, including Shweta Tiwari, Nakuul Mehta, Rannvijay Singha, Jasleen Royal and Sufi Motiwala, were also seen at the screening.

Punjabi artistes are India's passport to world, because beats break bordersPunjabi beats are rewriting pop culture's playlist globally. If you see that the world's dancing to it now, it's purely because of the global dominance of Punjabi artistes.

Awez Darbar warns Baseer Ali to lower his tone in Bigg Boss 19. Watch promoYou know the upcoming episode of a reality show is going to be an interesting one when a contestant ends his silence with a roar. A promo for the upcoming episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' promises exactly that and more.

Anushka-Virat were once kicked out of New Zealand cafe, says Jemimah RodriguesDuring their visit to New Zealand, Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were reportedly asked to leave a cafe after a lengthy conversation with Indian women cricketers Jemimah Rodrigues and Smriti Mandhana. The incident was shared by Rodrigues in a latest interview.

The Rip teaser: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck stuck in money, morality and mayhemHollywood's BFF Ben Affleck and Matt Damon are reuniting in the crime thriller 'The Rip'. The crime thriller is set to release on Netflix in January 2025, exploring themes of trust and betrayal among Miami police officers.

Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle advance booking bursts through the roof in India'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' advance booking smashes records in India, set to redefine animated film success. The pre-sales in India crossed Rs 10 crore, breaking non-Hollywood records and signalling the anime's growing box office impact.

general news.headline: Indian man beheaded in front of family after fight over washing machine in USYordanis Cobos-Martinez used a machete to fatally attack 50-year-old Chandra Mouli Nagamallaiah after an argument at the motel in Dallas. The victim was killed in front of his wife and son.

Video: Charlie Kirk killer seen running across roof before jumping and fleeingConservative influencer Charlie Kirk's killer remains at large after his shooting on a Utah college campus. The FBI officials on Friday released a video footage showing the suspect running and jumping from a rooftop.

Trump's envoy pick cites India's middle class, says want New Delhi to buy our oilSergio Gor, a close Trump aide and director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office, said that despite recent disagreements over tariffs and India's purchases of Russian oil, the US-India relationship continues to be "warm and strategically important."

Just ahead of Charlie Kirk's murder wife spoke of divine help in troubleErika Kirk, wife of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, posted a text from the Bible on 'help in trouble' just three hours before his death. Erika, a former beauty queen and mother of two, regularly posts texts from the Bible and on matters of faith.

Neighbourhood in turmoil: 'Vishwaguru' needs to step upPoverty, unemployment, corruption and misgovernance are a deadly mix that has caused a volcanic eruption of mob fury which has singed Nepal. New Delhi's foreign policy mandarins may not readily admit it but the scale and intensity of the protests led by the country's youthful demographic has clearly caught the Modi government off guard.

CP Radhakrishnan takes oath as 15th Vice-President; PM, Jagdeep Dhankhar presentCP Radhakrishnan was sworn in as India's 15th Vice-President on Friday by President Droupadi Murmu at Rashtrapati Bhavan. The V-P election was held following the sudden resignation of Jagdeep Dhankhar in July.

Cuban who beheaded Indian in US is a criminal, was freed by Biden administrationThe attack took place on Wednesday at the Downtown Suites motel in Dallas where the 50-year-old victim, Chandra Nagamallaiah and murder accused, Yordanis Cobos-Martinez (37) worked. The two were involved in an argument about a broken washing machine.

Jadavpur University third-year student found dead near campus lake, probe underwayAnamika Mondal, a third-year English student at Jadavpur University, was found unconscious near a campus pond on Thursday night.

How Charlie Kirk killing will impact chaos-hit US campusesUS college and university campuses, once known for high-quality education and a culture of inclusivity, have in recent years been in the news for growing cancel culture and incidents of violence. Conservative activist Charlie Kirk's killing at Utah Valley University could plunge American university campuses into a deeper crisis.

Trump praised PM even when critical of India: Envoy pick calls friendship 'unique'Speaking at his confirmation hearing in the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, Sergio Gor said President Trump had a 'deep friendship' with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Uneasy calm in Nepal; Sushila Karki likely to be appointed interim PM Live UpdatesAfter days of violent anti-corruption protests led by Nepalese youth that have left over 34 dead, an uneasy calm prevailed in Nepal on Friday. Today, all eyes will be on a key meeting on the formation of an interim government.

Gukesh faces hattrick of losses at Grand Swiss, sparks concernsIndia's D Gukesh's struggles at the FIDE Grand Swiss continued on Thursday. The Indian Grandmaster lost his third match in a row, sparking major concerns in the chess community.

How India's CV Raman helped Nasa discover signs of life on MarsTo confirm that the rock picked up by the rover from Mars had potential signs of life, planetary scientists and geologists relied on Indian physicist C V Raman.

Indian diplomat speaks Bhojpuri to welcome Mauritius PM in Varanasi. Watch videoRandhir Jaiswal's greeting set the tone for a warm welcome as Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted Mauritian Prime Minister Navinchandra Ramgoolam in Varanasi on September 11.

Meet Naveen Rao, Indian-origin AI chief leaving $100 billion DatabricksNaveen Rao, Databricks' AI chief, steps down to start a new venture focused on reducing AI computing costs. His exit comes as Databricks secures massive funding, raising questions on maintaining innovation momentum.

Bihar Congress posts AI video mocking PM Modi's mother; BJP leaders seek actionBihar Congress posted an AI-generated video on X that stages a dreamlike exchange between a PM Modi lookalike and an elderly woman presented as his late mother, Heeraben.

FBI releases new photos of suspect in Charlie Kirk's assassinationThe FBI released new photos of a person of interest in Charlie Kirk's assassination and announced a $100,000 reward for information leading to the identification and arrest.

Bihar teen who left home at 14 is only Indian finalist for Global Student Prize 2025From leaving home at 14 in Champaran, Bihar, to serving as a Google Youth Advisor and mentoring global competitions, Adarsh Kumar has transformed his journey into one that builds opportunities for countless students through fellowships, startups, and grassroots change. He is now the only Indian finalist (chosen from over 11,000 candidates) in the Global Student Prize 2025, the 'student Nobel Prize' which comes with Rs 87 lakh ($100,000).

World Athletics 2025: All you need to know about Neeraj Chopra-led Indian squadWorld Athletics Championships 2025: Neeraj Chopra leads India's 19-member squad in Tokyo from September 13. Here's all you need to know about the athletes, their schedule, and recent form.

The little beads of ear seeding are making big noise in the wellness worldIf you are a wellness girlie, you've probably seen people sharing photos of their ears adorned with tiny, shiny beads. These aren't piercings, they're ear seeding beads, part of a self-care trend that's rapidly gaining popularity.

Caught on camera: School bus topples over pothole in Bengaluru, 20 children rescuedBengaluru's pothole menace continues, with a school bus falling near Panathur Main Road. Twenty children were rescued. A day earlier, a woman in Mangaluru died after her scooter toppled into a pothole.

Congress leader's 'Nepal-like situation in India' remark triggers BJP backlashCongress leader Udit Raj has drawn fire from the BJP after suggesting that India could face a Nepal-like situation if not for the strength of its Constitution.

Came on visitor visa, were handed guns: Punjab men duped into joining Russian armySeveral young men from Punjab have been duped and forced into joining the Russian army. Their families urged the government to step in and ensure that they are evacuated from the warzone.

sports.headline: Why are India using Bronco Test? A deep dive into cutting-edge fitness drillsAdrian Le Roux, Indian men's cricket team's strength and conditioning coach reportedly proposed to BCCI that they should move on from the Yo-Yo Test. Le Roux in the latest BCCI video, speaks in details about the team's fitness and how it is achieved.

Mike Hesson's honest assessment of Babar Azam, Rizwan's strike rateAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan head coach Mike Hesson stressed the need for honest, objective assessments of players like Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan, focusing on adapting to modern T20 strike-rate demands rather than individual weaknesses.

Towhid Hridoy defends Bangladesh's slow approach in Hong Kong winTowhid Hridoy defended Bangladesh's measured approach in their Asia Cup 2025 opener, emphasising smart cricket and partnership-building over rushing the chase. His unbeaten 35, alongside Litton Das' 59, helped Bangladesh secure a seven-wicket win over Hong Kong.

No ISL promotion or relegation hurts football standards: Former India coach ColacoIndia's CAFA Nations Cup bronze under Khalid Jamil offered hope in tough times. Yet former coach Armando Colaco insists Indian football cannot progress without a proper promotion and relegation system in the ISL and I-League.

Have Pakistan been up to the mark without Babar Azam, Mohammad Rizwan?Pakistan enter the Asia Cup 2025 without Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan, testing if their new-look batting can match the reliability of the past. With mixed results this year but growing momentum, the tournament will reveal whether Pakistan's bold reinvention can finally end a 13-year wait.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
